1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Rio Vista has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Rio Vista continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Rio Vista's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Rio Vista's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Rio Vista has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Rio Vista has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Rio Vista now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Rio Vista employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Rio Vista will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Rio Vista has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Rio Vista, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Rio Vista has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name             | Process Chemical          | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration      Anhydrous Ammonia           17,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so th

at it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Rio Vista operates a commercial cold storage for a variety of fruit and vegetables in Reedley, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(2) Bin Rooms
(1) Blueberry Room (Packing Room)
(1) Glycol Chiller
(2) Hallways
(1) Loading Dock
(2) Precool Rooms
(2) Storage Rooms

1.2.2 Facility Location

Rio Vista is located at 8686 S Rio Vista, Reedley, CA 93654. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 36.607368, -119.472817. The facility is located approximately 8 miles east of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

Flood Hazards
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.

Seismic Susceptibility
Rio Vista is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Rio Vista has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

Direct-Expansion (DX) System

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Rio Vista has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Rio Vista facility is an integral part of the overall busin

ess and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Rio Vista has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Rio Vista emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- Cal/OSHA's Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements] - Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 40 CFR §68.95
- California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 §2731

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire 
Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team.
